title: JavaScript - an introduction
author: Farah
description: This book gives an introduction to JavaScript. JavaScript is a famous programming language that is known for being interactive and dynamic. It can be used in both Frontend development and Backend development functioning on both the client-side and server-side of web development. It acts as a bridge that can fetch the information needed from stored files such as a database or a JSON file and delivers it to the right part in the HTML code. It also acts like the manager that listens to events happening on the page using the EventListener. Those events include when a user clicks a button, reloads a page or changes the selection on a dropdown menu then responds to the user’s input in real-time with an appropriate action. Using JavaScript allows for the creation of an interactive and enhanced user experience. Another use of JavaScript in frontend development is form validation. JavaScript can be used to validate user input in real-time, providing immediate feedback to users if they have entered an invalid input. JavaScript interacts with the body of HTML by using the keyword “document”. Using that it can select any query by the id or class then it can manipulate the selected query such as getting the value and setting a new value inside the HTML element.

title: Responsive Bootstrap
author: Farah
description: This book talks about the “User Experience (UX)” which is an important part of designing digital products, such as websites or mobile applications. It focuses heavily on fulfilling the user’s needs along with providing a comfortable, flexible and pleasant interface for him to use. It keeps in mind the user's interaction with a product, including its visual design, ease of use, and overall functionality. The goal of UX is to create products that are easy and enjoyable to use, as well as effective in meeting the user's needs. In the context of web development, implementing UX in our web-designs can be very beneficial since it can improve the overall usability of a website. It does that by creating an intuitive and user-friendly interface, easing the process of visitors finding what they are looking for faster, and interactive elements that can increase the visitor’s satisfaction and therefore they will be more likely to return. This can help to increase traffic and revenue for the website as well as lead to brand loyalty and an increase in referrals and recommendations by the customer  to their friends and family. UX can also be used to fulfill the desired goals of the client who owns the website since it can dynamically place some elements of the page so it’s more likely to grab the visitors’ attention like special offers, limited items or the newest articles. This will increase the probability of a user to open, buy and consume exactly what the client wants them to. You can use UX in many creative ways such as, coordinating and harmonizing colors, animating elements, interactive and dynamic page sections and more!

title: CSS - an introduction
author: Farah
description: This book describes what CSS is. CSS stands for “Cascading Style Sheets”. It is a stylesheet language that is used to change the style of a page and format documents written in HTML. It is used to control the layout, formatting, and appearance of web pages. CSS allows a good level of organization since it separates the HTML content of the page from its visual design, making it easier to read, maintain and update. It also provides a high level of flexibility, allowing us to change the appearance of a website quickly and easily. CSS works by applying its rules to an HTML document. Those rules allow us to control the layout and styling of all elements within the document. Through the use of CSS we can control many aspects of those elements such as the background color, text color, background images, elements’ height, elements’ width, margins and paddings and many more. The rules can be applied directly to HTML elements or to a group of elements, such as a class or an ID. It can also be applied to small parts such as a first of a specific type, or the first child of an element. All these features allow for an easy customization of the appearance of a website. External stylesheets of CSS are saved as separate files with a .css extension and linked to the HTML document using the link tag. There is a more advanced version of CSS with more features called SCSS which stands for Sassy CSS. One of the advanced features it allows us to have is the ability to use nesting to organize our stylesheet, which makes it easier to read and maintain. Instead of having to repeat the same selector for each nested element, you can simply nest the elements within the parent selector.

title: HTML - an introduction
author: Farah
description: This book revolves around HTML which stands for Hypertext Markup Language. HTML is the standard language used for creating web pages and web applications. It’s written using different tags to define the structure and content of a web page. Most of the tags need to be opened and closed but some of them can be used without closing such as the “img” tag. HTML is an essential tool for a web developer since it provides a way to create different elements and structure the contents in a way that can be easily understood and displayed by web browsers. The structure of the page usually includes a head section where many details are provided so that the web browser can handle the page in a better way such as the title of the page, the language that the page will use, scripts and style sheets and more. This part of HTML isn’t visible to the user. There is also the body section where all of the contents of the page are usually written. Tags in the body include headings, paragraphs, images, links, and other elements that make up the content of a web page. HTML is compatible with other web technologies such as CSS and JavaScript, allowing developers to create dynamic and interactive web pages with great functionality and styling. HTML can also be formatted by different frameworks such as Bootstrap. Bootstrap is a popular open-source front-end framework that is used for building responsive web pages. Adding it to HTML gives the page grid formatting which usually uses the structure; container, row, column. This structure gives HTML a dynamic look that can suit many screen sizes.
